lwm2m.binding-tooltip:
This is the list in the"binding" resource of the LwM2M server object - /1/x/7.
Indicates the supported binding modes in the LwM2M Client.
This value SHOULD be the same as the value in the “Supported Binding and Modes” resource in the Device Object (/3/0/16).
While multiple transports are supported, only one transport binding can be used during the entire Transport Session.
As an example, when UDP and SMS are both supported, the LwM2M Client and the LwM2M Server can choose to communicate either over UDP or SMS during the entire Transport Session.

binding-type.h: H: Client is reachable via the HTTP binding at any time.
binding-type.m: M: Client is reachable via the MQTT binding at any time.
binding-type.n: N: Client MUST send the response to such a request over the Non-IP binding (is supported since LWM2M 1.1).
binding-type.s: S: Client is reachable via the SMS binding at any time.
binding-type.sq: SQ: SMS connection in queue mode (is not supported since LWM2M 1.1)
binding-type.t: T: Client is reachable via the TCP binding at any time.
binding-type.tq: TQ: TCP connection in queue mode (is not supported since LWM2M 1.1)
binding-type.tqs: TQS: both TCP and SMS connections active; TCP in queue mode, SMS in standard mode (is not supported since LWM2M 1.1)
binding-type.u: U: Client is reachable via the UDP binding at any time.
binding-type.uq: UQ: UDP connection in queue mode (is not supported since LWM2M 1.1)
binding-type.uqs: UQS: both UDP and SMS connections active; UDP in queue mode, SMS in standard mode (is not supported since LWM2M 1.1)

device-profile.mqtt-enable-compatibility-with-json-payl: Activer la compatibilité avec d'autres formats de payloads.

Lorsqu'activé, la plateforme utilisera un format de payload Protobuf par défaut. Si le parsing échoue, la pateforme tentera d'utiliser le format JSON. Utile pour compatibilité avec version antérieures lors de mises à jour du firmware. Par exemple, la version originale du firmware utilisait JSON, alors que la nouvelle version du firmware utilise Protobuf. Durant le processus de mise à jour du firmware pour une flotte de dispositifs, il est requis de supporter à la fois JSON et Protobuf simultanément. Ce mode de compatibilité est légèrement moins performant alors il est recommandé de le désactivé une fois tous les dispositifs mis à jour.
device-profile.mqtt-send-ack-on-validation-exception: Send PUBACK on PUBLISH message validation failure
device-profile.mqtt-send-ack-on-validation-exception-hi: By default, the platform will close the MQTT session on message validation failure. When enabled, the platform will send publish acknowledgment instead of closing the session.
device-profile.mqtt-use-json-format-for-default-downlin: Utilisez le format JSON pouir les sujets de downlink par défaut

Lorsqu'activé, la plateforme utilisera le format de payload JSON pour pousser des attributs et des RPC via les sujets suivants: v1/devices/me/attributes/response/$request_id, v1/devices/me/attributes, v1/devices/me/rpc/request/$request_id, v1/devices/me/rpc/response/$request_id. This setting does not impact attribute and rpc subscriptions sent using new (v2) topics: v2/a/res/$request_id, v2/a, v2/r/req/$request_id, v2/r/res/$request_id. Où $request_id est un identifiant de requête entier.

entity-view.attributes-propagation-hint: La vue d'entité copiera automatiquement les attributs spécifiés de l'entité cible chaque fois que vous enregistrez ou mettez à jour cette vue d'entité. Pour des raisons de performances, les attributs d'entité cible ne sont pas propagés à la vue d'entité à chaque changement d'attribut. Vous pouvez activer la propagation automatique en configurant le noeud de règle " copier pour afficher " dans votre chaîne de règles et en liant les messages "Post attributs " et "attributs mis à jour " au nouveau noeud de règle.

step1.content:
A tenant is an individual or an organization that owns or produces devices and assets. The tenant may have multiple tenant administrator users, customers, devices, and assets.

The Tenant Administrator can create and manage devices, assets, customers, and dashboards within the tenant account.

Follow the documentation on how to do it:
step1.how-to-create-tenant: How to create Tenant & Tenant Administrator
step1.title: Create Tenant & Tenant Administrator

step2.content:
Mail server configuration is essential for user activation, password recovery, and alarm notification delivery.

Follow the documentation on how to do it:
step2.title: Configure feature: Mail server

step3.content:
Configure SMS providers to notify the customers about the alarms via SMS.

Follow the documentation on how to do it:
step3.title: Configure feature: SMS provider

step4.content:
Improve security of the platform accounts with two-factor authentication.

Follow the documentation on how to do it:
step4.title: Configure feature: 2FA

step5.content:
Simplify login for the tenant and customer users with Single Sign-On functionality via OAuth 2.0.

Follow the documentation on how to do it:
step5.title: Configure feature: OAuth 2

step6.content:
Distribute notifications to the tenant and customer users via Slack according to the notification rules you set.

Follow the documentation on how to do it:
step6.title: Configure feature: Slack

step1.content: Let's provision your first device to the platform via UI. Follow the documentation on how to do it:
step1.title: Create device

step2.content-after:
You can also use other protocols such as MQTT, CoAP, etc.

Follow the documentation on how to do it:
step2.content-before:
To connect the device you need to get the device credentials. We recommend using default auto-generated credentials which is access token for this guide.

  • Go to device table
  • Click on the device row to open device details
  • Press the button "Copy access token"

Use simple commands to publish data over HTTP. Don't forget to replace $ACCESS_TOKEN with your device access token:
step2.title: Connect device

windows.install-curl: Starting Windows 10 b17063, cURL is available by default.

step3.content:
Create a dashboard to visualize data from entities such as assets, devices, etc.

Follow the documentation on how to do it:
step3.title: Create dashboard

step4.content: Let's raise an alarm when the temperature reaches 25°C. Follow the documentation on how to do it:
step4.title: Configure alarm rules

step5.content-after: Follow the documentation on how to do it:
step5.content-before: To trigger the alarm, send a new telemetry value of 26°C or higher.
step5.title: Create alarm

step6.content:
By creating end-user dashboards, a customer user can only see his own devices, and data from another customer will be hidden.

Follow the documentation on how to do it:
step6.how-to-create-customer-and-assign-dashbo: How to create Customer and assign Dashboard
step6.title: Create customer and assign dashboard
